body:
I met an error as below when fluentd tried to stdout a hash including Float::NAN. 

```
2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: emit transaction failed  error="'NaN' is an invalid number"
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:72:in `encode'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:22:in `dump'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/fluentd-0.10.35/lib/fluent/plugin/out_stdout.rb:26:in `block in emit'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:72:in `encode'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:72:in `encode'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:72:in `encode'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:72:in `encode'
  2013-07-18 12:39:46 +0900 [warn]: /usr/lib64/fluent/ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/yajl-ruby-1.1.0/lib/yajl.rb:22:in `dump'
```

It occurs by `Yajl.dump(record)` at  https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/blob/master/lib/fluent/plugin/out_stdout.rb#L24, and yes, JSON does not have any representations for NaN as stated at https://github.com/avsej/yaji/blob/master/ext/yaji/api/yajl_gen.h#L127

I believe similar things occur for other non-JSONable datatypes too. My idea to fix this is not to convert into JSON in out_stdout plugin. What do you think?
title: emit transaction failed  error="'NaN' is an invalid number" (out_stdout)
